intro: Callista daphniflora, commonly known as the golden bell tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has smooth, grey-green leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Callista daphniflora is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
